flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1200>>1200
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=130>>130
He wants to put half of $130 into a retirement account so he will invest 130/2= $<<130/2=65>>65 into his retirement account
He had 130 and puts $65 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 130-65 = $<<130-65=65>>65 remaining
#### 65

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1300, not 130. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
